title: Field Remedy: 1826
subject:
Spark plug damages - possible causes and
failure modes

metadata.complaintGroup:
01 - Broken or Cracked,05 - Excessive
wear,11 - Loose or Comes off,13 - No/Poor Function,18 - Poor
Drivebility,19 - Poor Engine Driveability,20 - Poor Performance,21
- Poor Startability,22 - Smokes

items: thermal overload at centre-, ground electrode, insulator foot

remedyContent.text:
Tightening torque too low (
< 15 Nm) - spark plug was not correct tightened thereby the heat transfer was   disturbed - centre-, ground electrode and insulator foot are melted

items: vibration marks at the terminal head

remedyContent.text:
Through vibrations the spark plug loosened and the centre
electrode broke.

items: Broken centre- and ground electrode (Picture III)

remedyContent.text:
Tightening torque too low (
< 15 Nm) - thickness of outer sealing ring >
 1,4 mm

The spark plugs loosened caused by vibrations. Hence it follows breaking of
ground- and centre electrode and break out of the insulator foot.

Through shaking of the plug the spark plug has been completely
destructed.

items: strong tracks of the spark plug -wrench at the hexagon

remedyContent.text:
Subsequent damage (e.g. engine, cylinder) caused by described
failures must not be covered by warranty.
